reviews.review_msg: A lot of work was required for this first year online course. "Workbook" weeks would consist of 6-7+ exercises with several questions each pertaining to a different reading, video, etc. Some weeks would take upwards of 5+ hours to complete as there would be 2 hours films in addition to pages of readings and questions.

She said we had a "quiz" and it ended up being a test with 180 questions! Our second "quiz" had 260 and even though I attended every lecture the tests were outrageous. She made us read 15-20 long articles weekly and tested us on them all so you had no choice but to read them all to pass the test. Too tough for a first year course-not recommended.

Worst class I have taken. Appalling.  Readings are insane for a first year course. More than my three other upper division courses combined, plus 3 hours of youtube videos; all testable.  The marking is so unclear. Everything is unclear.  Avoid at all costs, I will never take another FNST course at SFU, students are contesting with the faculty.

Annie is a great professor. She cares about her students and knows a lot more about the material than is perceived. If you go to her office hours for help, she will help you. I loved the way she structured the class - more peer based presentations. It made things a lot more interesting.

I took this course online and the formatting was ridiculous. It was so unclear which discussion group we were in and more than one person did the wrong week (& got NO marks as a result). Quiz 1 was extremely specific. The first question had us complete a quote from a reading in first week. Discussion = mandatory but very difficult in groups online.

i just dont get why the exam has to ask you some tiny detail from some random article. A LOT OF READING. At the first exam we had questions that her never teach us!!!! And she said in a exam if a question are too hard/not making sense she would cancel it UNLESS NO ONE CHOOSE THE RIGHT ANSWER. there was 200+ student, wtf.

Useless.  And really rude.  I would NOT RECOMMEND.  Tests/assignments/readings are bogus and are stupidly detailed...  Get ready to memorize your readings... Which are found on WebCT... Sometimes photocopied upsidedown.

Good God. Midterms are ridiculous, readings took well over three hours weekly, and she favoured students. Would not recommend for a first year class; it's full of 2nd and 3rd years, and papers are marked relative to each other, so first years have a huge disadvantage.  Made some sweeping statements about "Non-Aboriginals" which was kinda unsettling

The course was not particularly well organized. The syllabus, WebCT page, and assignment instructions reflected this. She could be kind and open to feedback, but also did sometimes treat students as less than adult.

Not organized at all. Unclear and not helpful. Prof made me feel like I was stupid when I asked her questions. Made every assignment unclear so make sure you ask lots of questions even if it annoys the TA. Overall received a B, but not worth the frustration I had to put up with.

This prof is okay. The subject material is just really dry and if you are looking to boost your GPA, then i suggest you DONT take this class. Her midterms are kinda ridiculous since the questions were kinda random. Maybe this is just me but she was nice to the class in the beginning but after the evaluations, she just kinda turned mean!
Great prof!
Teaches completely subjective information, unprofessional in this manner. A VERY nice woman with lots of information, but I'm looking for objectivity to a certain extent in classes.
she aight

She is a wonderful prof. She is eager to help students do well in her class.
 
 You need to be able to discuss things in class. So participation is needed.
 
 Her textbook is easy to follow and not dry. 
 
 Her TA was awesome as well (Sean).
 
 Go to her office hours and discuss class material with her. She does want students to do well in her clas
great prof! really nice and lets the class decide what format the midterms are. also, no final!!! really easy class

Well, she's kind of ridiculous.  She cries in class and she goes off on rants and tangents and terrorizes anyone who disagrees with her. She can seem wonderful, until you actually need to speak to her.  Then she's not helpful in the slightest.  That certain type of person who doesn't really listen to the question and answers it with something rando
Let me just come out and say that I absolutely love her!  However don't take her course if you're expecting an objective point of view or a comprehensible marking scheme.

Great Prof.  May be frustrating for students looking for a very structured class since discussions are frequently chaotic and assignment topic/format is left up to you.  Exams focus on points raised in class discussions so attendance and participation are key.  Overall, a friendly and creative prof that rewards effort and participation.

This class was amazing. For anyone really sick of first year classes because they are incredibly boring and structured, annie really increases your opinion of intro classes. She encourages discussion in class and lets the students decide the exam questions. The project is completely open too.
